intro: Parathesis hondurensis, commonly known as the Honduras parathesis, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. It thrives in tropical climates with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
